sanskrit_verse:
अपह्नवेऽधमर्णस्य देहीत्युक्तस्य संसदि ।
अभियोक्ता दिशेद्देश्यं करणं वाऽन्यदुद्दिशेत् ॥ ८.५२॥
transliteration:
apahnave 'dhamarṇasya dehītyuktasya saṁsadi |
abhiyoktā diśeddeśyaṁ karaṇaṁ vā'nyaduddiśet || 8.52||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a debtor of low character denies his obligation in the assembly after having previously acknowledged it, the accuser shall direct him to fulfill the specified duty or designate another action appropriate to restore the debt and integrity.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the accuser to initiate completion when denial disrupts dharma
Causation is established through prior acknowledgment followed by denial
Capacity-based responsibility requires proportional restoration aligned with awareness
Restoration logic mandates fulfillment or substitution based on capacity
Consciousness alignment demands truth-responsibility over punitive concealment
executable_legal_axioms: IF debtor acknowledges obligation THEN memory-event binds capacity
IF acknowledgment is later denied IN public assembly THEN accuser may activate completion protocol
IF original duty cannot be performed THEN substitute duty must align with debtor's current capacity
ALL actions MUST preserve relational dharma AND social coherence
NO punitive measure SHALL be enacted; restoration occurs via conscious reintegration
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that denial of a previously admitted obligation constitutes a disruption of nyāya. The court, as representative of dharma-adjudicative authority, must ensure that the accused assumes completion either through original commitment or equivalent substitute, without invoking punitive frameworks.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through witnessed admission. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as denial disrupting sequential dharmic flow. Responsibility is proportional to the act of contradiction. Non-punitive reality rule applies as justice functions to reintegrate capacity rather than impose suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Completion Directive: Require debtor to reaffirm or execute original duty
Substitution Alignment Process: Assign alternate duty matching current capacity
Witness Reaffirmation Protocol: Reconstruct event through witness-consciousness integration
Integrity Restoration Circuit: Engage debtor in self-corrective alignment with relational dharma
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma is executed. Truth-responsibility is restored. Denial dissolves in alignment. Consciousness prevails as the supreme adjudicator. All acts are for reintegration, not punishment.
